verses.text: In the five and twentieth year of our captivity, in the beginning of the year, in the tenth \add day\add* of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was smitten, in the same day the hand of the LORD was upon me, and brought me thither.
In the visions of God he brought me into the land of Israel, and set me upon a very high mountain, by which \add was\add* as the frame of a city on the south.

And he brought me thither, and behold, \add there was\add* a man, whose appearance \add was\add* like the appearance of brass, with a line of flax in his hand, and a measuring reed; and he stood in the gate.

And the man said to me, Son of man, behold with thy eyes, and hear with thy ears, and set thy heart upon all that I shall show thee; for, to the intent that I might show \add them\add* to thee \add art\add* thou brought hither: declare all that thou seest to the house of Israel.

And behold a wall on the outside of the house around, and in the man's hand a measuring reed of six cubits \add long\add* by the cubit and a hand-breadth: so he measured the breadth of the building, one reed: and the hight, one reed.

Then he came to the gate which looketh towards the east, and ascended its stairs, and measured the threshhold of the gate, \add which was\add* one reed broad; and the other threshhold \add of the gate\add* , \add which was\add* one reed broad.

And \add every\add* little chamber \add was\add* one reed long, and one reed broad; and between the little chambers \add were\add* five cubits; and the threshhold of the gate by the porch of the gate within \add was\add* one reed.
He measured also the porch of the gate within, one reed.
Then he measured the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and its posts, two cubits; and the porch of the gate \add was\add* inward.

And the little chambers of the gate eastward \add were\add* three on this side, and three on that side; they three \add were\add* of one measure: and the posts had one measure on this side and on that side.
And he measured the breadth of the entry of the gate, ten cubits; \add and\add* the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.

The space also before the little chambers \add was\add* one cubit \add on this side\add* , and the space \add was\add* one cubit on that side: and the little chambers \add were\add* six cubits on this side, and six cubits on that side.
He measured then the gate from the roof of \add one\add* little chamber to the roof of another: the breadth \add was\add* five and twenty cubits, door against door.
He made also posts of sixty cubits; even to the post of the court around the gate.
And from the face of the gate of the entrance to the face of the porch of the inner gate \add were\add* fifty cubits.

And \add there were\add* narrow windows to the little chambers, and to their posts within the gate around, and likewise to the arches: and windows \add were\add* around inward: and upon \add each\add* post \add were\add* palm-trees.
Then he brought me into the outward court, and lo, \add there were\add* chambers, and a pavement made for the court around: thirty chambers \add were\add* upon the pavement.
And the pavement by the side of the gates over against the length of the gates \add was\add* the lower pavement.
Then he measured the breadth from the front of the lower gate to the front of the inner court without, a hundred cubits eastward and northward.
And the gate of the outward court that looked towards the north, he measured its length, and its breadth.

And the little chambers of it \add were\add* three on this side and three on that side; and its posts and its arches were after the measure of the first gate; its length \add was\add* fifty cubits, and its breadth five and twenty cubits.

And their windows, and their arches, and their palm-trees, \add were\add* after the measure of the gate that looketh towards the east; and they went up to it by seven steps; and its arches \add were\add* before them.
And the gate of the inner court \add was\add* over against the gate towards the north, and towards the east; and he measured from gate to gate a hundred cubits.
After that he brought me towards the south, and behold a gate towards the south: and he measured its posts and its arches according to these measures.
And \add there were\add* windows in it and in its arches around, like those windows: the length \add was\add* fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.
And \add there were\add* seven steps to go up to it, and its arches \add were\add* before them: and it had palm-trees, one on this side, and another on that side, upon its posts.
And \add there was\add* a gate in the inner court towards the south: and he measured from gate to gate towards the south a hundred cubits.
And he brought me to the inner court by the south gate; and he measured the south gate according to these measures;

And its little chambers, and its posts, and its arches, according to these measures; and \add there were\add* windows in it and in its arches around: \add it was\add* fifty cubits long, and five and twenty cubits broad.
And the arches around \add were\add* five and twenty cubits long, and five cubits broad.
And its arches \add were\add* towards the outer court; and palm-trees \add were\add* upon its posts: and the ascent to it \add had\add* eight steps.
And he brought me into the inner court towards the east: and he measured the gate according to these measures.

And its little chambers, and its posts, and its arches, \add were\add* according to these measures; and \add there were\add* windows in it and in its arches around: \add it was\add* fifty cubits long, and five and twenty cubits broad.
And its arches \add were\add* towards the outward court; and palm-trees were upon its posts, on this side, and on that side: and the ascent to it \add had\add* eight steps.
And he brought me to the north gate, and measured \add it\add* according to these measures;
Its little chambers, its posts, and its arches, and the windows to it around: the length \add was\add* fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.
And its posts \add were\add* towards the outer court; and palm-trees \add were\add* upon its posts, on this side, and on that side: and the ascent to it \add had\add* eight steps.
And the chambers and its entries \add were\add* by the posts of the gates, where they washed the burnt-offering.
And in the porch of the gate \add were\add* two tables on this side, and two tables on that side, to slay upon it the burnt-offering and the sin-offering and the trespass-offering.
And at the side without, as one goeth up to the entry of the north gate, \add were\add* two tables; and on the other side, which \add was\add* at the porch of the gate, \add were\add* two tables.
Four tables \add were\add* on this side, and four tables on that side, by the side of the gate; eight tables, upon which they slew \add their sacrifices\add* .

And the four tables \add were\add* of hewn stone for the burnt-offering, of a cubit and a half long, and a cubit and a half broad, and one cubit high: upon which also they laid the instruments with which they slew the burnt-offering and the sacrifice.
And within \add were\add* hooks, a hand broad, fastened around: and upon the tables \add was\add* the flesh of the offering.

And without the inner gate \add were\add* the chambers of the singers in the inner court, which \add was\add* at the side of the north gate; and their prospect \add was\add* towards the south: one at the side of the east gate \add having\add* the prospect towards the north.
And he said to me, This chamber, whose prospect \add is\add* towards the south, \add is\add* for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the house.

And the chamber whose prospect \add is\add* towards the north \add is\add* for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the altar: these \add are\add* the sons of Zadok among the sons of Levi, who come near to the LORD to minister to him.
So he measured the court, a hundred cubits long, and a hundred cubits broad, foursquare; and the altar \add that was\add* before the house.

And he brought me to the porch of the house, and measured \add each\add* post of the porch, five cubits on this side, and five cubits on that side: and the breadth of the gate \add was\add* three cubits on this side, and three cubits on that side.

The length of the porch \add was\add* twenty cubits, and the breadth eleven cubits; and \add he brought me\add* by the steps by which they went up to it: and \add there were\add* pillars by the posts, one on this side, and another on that side.
